name: Chapter 5: Ensuring People-Centered, Clean and Efficient Governance
People-centered, innovative, clean, efficient, effective and inclusive delivery of public goods and services ensured
Anti-corruption initiatives improved
Seamless service delivery achieved
Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority increased (%)
Number of regulatory agencies covered by the regulatory review increased
Number of OFW Help Desks (OHDs) available increased
Rightsizing the National Government Act of 2017 passed
Proportion of LGUs adopting PFM improvement measures (cumulative, %)
Administrative governance enhanced
Citizenry fully engaged and empowered
Number of voters education and information campaigns conducted increased

Percentage of PCMs with the required NGO representation in the Local Development Council (including ARMM) increased: - Provinces; - Cities; - Municipalities; and - All NGAs fully complying with the Transparency Seal
Civil service accountability and performance management enhanced
Number of PCMs fully disclosing financial documents to the public: - Provinces; - Cities; and - Municipalities
Chapter 6: Pursuing Swift and Fair Administration of Values Justice
Swift and fair administration of justice ensured
Civil, criminal, commercial and administrative justice systems enhanced
Number of justice zones established increased
Number of courts with rolled-out continous trial increased
Number of courts with rolled-out e-courts increased
Philippine Mediation Center (PMC) units established
Sector efficiency and accountability improved
Percentage of qualified inmates (based on court orders for release) in city/municipal/district jails released on time maintained
Percentage of qualified inmates (granted parole/pardon and served sentence) in national prisons released on time maintained
Prosecutor to court ratio improved (cumulative)
Public attorney to court ratio improved (cumulative)
All requests for free legal assistance/representation acted upon within three (3) working days from date of request maintained (%)
Victims Compensation Program beneficiaries increased
Chapter 7: Promoting Philippine Culture and Values
Philippine culture and values promoted
Core Indicators
Increased level of awareness of the following: Filipino Values, Cultural diversity, Creativity, Culture sensitivity
Enhanced tolerance and respect for others
Inclusion of culture in all development plans in key growth areas according to the National Spatial Strategy
Heightened pride of place and pride of being Filipino
Reached the target number of beneficiaries (individuals, groups, organizations, communities) who were provided support
Sub-sector outcome
Diverse cultures valued
"Pagkamalikhain" values of creative excellence advanced
Values that foster the common good inculcated
Culture-sensitive public governance and development strengthened
Chapter 8: Expanding Economic Opportunities in Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries
Economic opportunities in agriculture, forestry and fisheries expanded
Agriculture, forestry and fisheries productivity within ecological limit improved
Program area for perennial crops provided with technical support services increased (ha) (Mango, Coffee, Cacao,Rubber, Banana, Pineapple, Cassava, Abaca and Coconut)
Program harvest area for staple crops provided with technical support services increased (ha) (Palay, Yellow Corn and White Corn)
Number of group beneficiaries provided with technical support services increased
Number of fisherfolk provided with production support increased
Number of group beneficiaries provided with agricultural and fishery machineries and equipment increased
Area within the production forest, for tree plantation and non-timber forest products increased (ha, cumulative) (Tree Plantation and Non-Timber Forest Products)
Agriculture, forestry and fishery-based enterprises increased
Number of AFF-enterprises with technical support increased
Access to economic opportunities by small farmers and fisherfolk increased
Access to id chains increased
Access to technology increased
Share of AFF research and development (R&D) government budget to total AFF GVA increased (%, cumulative)
Number of new technologies increased
Number of beneficiaries provided with extension services increased
Access to innovative financing increased
Number of small farmer/fisherfolk organizations participated in institutional capacity building on innovative financing increased (cumulative)
Proportion of LGUs with established partnerships for the implementation of agricultural insurance to the total number of LGUs increased (%, cumulative)
Access by small farmers and fisherfolk to land and water resources increased and protected
Area distributed under CARP increased (ha, cumulative)
Number of ARBs with EP/CLOAs increased (cumulative)
Area of collective CLOAs subdivided increased (ha, cumulative)
Number of registered fisherfolk provided with livelihood projects increased
Chapter 9: Expanding Economic Opportunities in Industry and Services
Economic opportunities in Industry and Services (I&S) expanded
Local and foreign investments increased
Total approved investments increased (PHP million)
Net FDI increased (USD million)
Number of harmonized investment promotion activities conducted
Competitiveness, innovativeness and resilience increased
Philippine Business Registry (PBR) fully operationalized (% of agencies involvement)
Number of cities/municipalities with fully- implemented Business Permit and Licensing System connected to the PBR
Number of Filipino trademarks registered increased
Market access improved
Consumer access to safe and quality goods and services ensured
Number of consumer awareness and advocacy initiatives undertaken
Number of consumer education, information and communication materials produced
Increased access to economic opportunities in Industry and Services (I&S) for micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs), cooperatives and overseas Filipinos (OFs)
Access to production networks improved
Number of MSMEs participating in Global id Chains
Number of MSMEs/Cooperatives integrated into corporate id chains increased
Number of Go Negosyo centers established
Access to finance improved
Productivity, efficiency and resilience improved
Number of shared service facilities established
Number of Small Enterprise Technology Upgrading Program beneficiaries increased
Number of clients/customers provided with testing and calibration services increased
Chapter 10: Accelerating Human Capital Development
Human Capital Development Accelerated
Nutrition and health for all improved
Care at all life stages guaranteed
Access through functional service delivery networks ensured
Health financing sustained
Lifelong learning opportunities for all ensured
Quality, accessible, relevant, and liberating basic education for all achieved
Quality of higher education and technical education and research for equity and global competitiveness improved
Income-earning ability increased
Employability improved
Productivity improved
Chapter 11: Reducing Vulnerability of Individuals and Families
Vulnerability of individuals and families reduced
Universal and transformative Social Protection (SP) for all achieved
Percentage of population covered by PhilHealth insurance (cumulative)
Proportion of poor senior citizens covered by social pension (cumulative)
Number of Conditional Cash Transfer (CCT) beneficiaries covered (cumulative)
Percentage of economically active population contributing to SSS pension scheme increased (cumulative)
Percentage of employed in the government covered by GSIS
Number of OFW membership to OWWA increased (cumulative)
Number of child laborers assisted
Number of families with child laborers provided with livelihood assistance
Percentage of families affected by natural and human-induced calamities provided with relief assistance
Percentage of emergency shelter assistance provided
All emergency loan applications by calamity-affected GSIS members and pensioners granted (%)
Ratio of total government spending in SP to GDP increased (%)
Ratio of total government spending in SP to the national budget increased (%)
Chapter 12: Building Safe and Secure Communities
Access to affordable, adequate, safe, and secure shelter in well-planned communities expanded
Proportion of socialized housing targets met to housing needs improved (%) (cumulative)
Proportion of low-cost housing targets met to housing needs improved (%) (Cumulative)
Number of socialized housing units delivered (cumulative)
Number of low-cost housing units delivered (cumulative)
Chapter 13: Reaching for the Demographic Dividend
Demographic transition accelerated
Maximize gains from the demographic dividend
Chapter 14: Vigorously Advancing Science, Technology, and Innovation
Technology adoption promoted and accelerated
STI (science, technology and innovation) utilization in agriculture, industry and services sectors increased
Number of technology adopters increased (incremental)
Number of Filipino patents granted increased (cumulative)
Number of Filipino utility models registered increased (cumulative)
Number of Filipino industrial designs registered increased (cumulative)
Investments in STI start-ups, enterprises and spin offs increased
Number of technology business incubators (TBI) graduates increased (i.e. enterprises and spin-offs)
Number of innovation hubs increased (e.g. TBIs, innovation centers, niche centers, etc.) (cumulative)
R&D expenditure of business enterprises increased (in PHP Billion)
Innovation stimulated
Creative capacity for knowledge and technology generation, acquisition and adoptions enhanced
R&D expenditure as a proportion of GDP increased (in percent, cumulative)
Number of Researchers, Scientists and Engineers (RSEs) per million population Increased (cumulative)
Number of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) enrollees in higher education institutes (HEIs) increased (in million, cumulative)
Number of STEM graduates in HEIs increased
Number of STEM enrolled in high school increased
Number of STEM graduates in high school increased
Number of scientific articles published in International Scientific Indexing (ISI)/Scopus Index Journal by Filipino authors increased
Number of Innovation Hubs Established
Number of Balik Scientists Engaged increased (cumulative)
Open collaboration among actors in STI ecosystem strengthened
Number of collaborations between HEIs and industries increased (cumulative)
Number of collaborations between HEIs and government increased (NGAs and LGUs) (cumulative)
Number of STI-related international cooperation of HEIs increased (cumulative)
Number of new STI-related international cooperation of NGAs increased
Chapter 15: Ensuring Sound Macroeconomic Policy
Stable, sound and supportive macroeconomic environment sustained
Responsible, strategic, and supportive fiscal sector achieved
Incremental revenue of BIR with the implementation of tax administration and tax policy reform realized (% of GDP)
Incremental revenue of BOC with the implementation of tax administration and tax policy reform realized (% of GDP)
Incremental revenue of LTO with the implementation of tax administration and tax policy reform realized (% of GDP)
Number of Public Financial Management (PFM) practitioners who attended at least one PFM Competency Program (PFMCP) course increased
Number of training activities conducted on Government Procurement Reform Act (RA 9184) and its revised implementing rules and regulations (IRR) increased
Foreign currency debt maintained within debt management targets (% of total outstanding debt)
Average maturity of NG debt portfolio maintained within strategic guidelines (residual maturity in years)
All LGUs assessed on revenue and assessment performance (% of LGUs)
Resilient and inclusive monetary and financial sectors achieved
Strategic external trade policy regime achieved
Number of DTI-assisted technology-enabled and technology-based exporters increased
Number of validated enrollees to the Regional Interactive Platform for Philippine Exporters (RIPPLES) Plus Program exporting increased
Number of new export products certified as Halal increased
Chapter 16: Formulating the Framework for National Competition Policy
Consumer welfare improved
Market efficiency improved
Anti-competitive practices diminished
Barriers to entry reduced
Limits to entrepreneurship reduced
Proportion of recommendations based on review of legislation and policies that may substantially prevent, restrict, or lessen competition (%)
Number of rules and regulations reviewed
Proportion of corrective measures for identified GOCCs initiated (%, cumulative)
Chapter 17: Attaining Just and Lasting Peace
Just and lasting peace attained
Peace agreements with all internal armed conflict groups successfully negotiated and implemented
Number of peace agreements signed
Number of final peace agreements substantially implemented
Number of encounters with internal non-state armed conflict groups
Percentage of former combatants who have completed covered by integration, healing and reconciliation programs
Number of non-state armed groups transitioned into legitimate socioeconomic / political organizations
Communities in conflict-affected and conflict vulnerable areas protected and developed
Number of barangays affected by internal armed conflict
Number of individuals displaced due to internal armed conflict

Percentage of conflict-affected and conflict-vulnerable barangays rehabilitated - Percentage of HH with access to potable and safe water - Maternal mortality rate - Child mortality rate - Completion rate (elementary and secondary) - Participation rat
Number of local government units in conflict-affected and conflict-vulnerable areas with local development plans integrating conflict sensitive and peace promoting approaches
Number of formal educational institutions integrating peace education into their curriculum
Number of reported human rights and IHL violations cases
Chapter 18: Ensuring Security, Public Order, and Safety
Security, public order and safety ensured
Territorial integrity and sovereignty upheld and protected
All forms of criminality and illegal drugs significantly reduced
Public safety ensured
Security and safety of overseas Filipinos ensured
Chapter 19: Accelerating Strategic Infrastructure Development
Access to economic opportunities increased
Competitiveness and productivity of economic sectors increased
New roads constructed (lane km, cumulative)
Total length of standard gauge rail tracks increased (km, cumulative)
Number of night-rated airports increased
Rehabilitated irrigation service areas increased (Existing Areas (ha))
Rehabilitated irrigation service areas increased (Canals(km))
Restored irrigation service areas increased (ha) - National Irrigation System (NIS)
Restored irrigation service areas increased (ha) - Small-scale Irrigation Systems
Developed new service areas increased (ha) -NIS
Developed new service areas increased (ha) -SSIS
Coverage area of irrigation facilities increased (ha, cumulative)
Renewable Energy (RE) capacity increased (MW, cumulative)
Gaps in basic infrastructure for human capital development reduced
Proportion of HHs with access to safe water supply to total number of HHs increased (%, cumulative)
Proportion of cities/municipalities served by water districts with 24/7 water supply increased (%, cumulative)
Number of households served by WDs with water service connections increased (cumulative)
Volume of desludged and/or treated septage in WDs increased (m3)
Proportion of HHs with electricity to total number of HHs increased (%, cumulative)
Proportion of barangays with access to Material Recovery Facilities (MRFs) to total no. of barangays (%, cumulative)
Proportion of barangays with access to Sanitary Land Fills (SLFs) to total number of barangays (%, cumulative)
Human capital development accelerated
Gaps in basic infrastructure for human capital development reduced
Proportion of public schools with connection to electricity to total number of public schools increased (%, cumulative) - Primary (K to 6) - Junior High School - Senior High School
Proportion of public schools with internet access to total number of public schools increased (%, cumulative) - Primary (K to 6) - Junior High School - Senior High School
Proportion of public schools with computer packages to total number of public schools increased (%, cumulative) - Primary (K to 6) - Junior High School - Senior High School
Vulnerability of the poor reduced
Safety and security against natural and man-made disasters, especially for the poor improved.
Technology adoption advanced and innovation stimulated
Innovative solutions and technologies encouraged/adopted
Chapter 20: Ensuring Ecological Integrity, Clean and Healthy Environment
Ecological integrity ensured and socioeconomic condition of resource-based communities improved
Biodiversity and functioning of ecosystem services sustained
Area of denuded and degraded forestland decreased (M ha, cumulative)
Area planted with mangroves increased (ha)
Area of forestland under effective management increased (M ha, cumulative)
Production and protection forests delineated increased (km)
Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas increased (%)
Area of marine protected areas with high biodiversity values effectively managed increased (ha)
Number of coastal municipalities and cities with delineated and adopted municipal waters increased (annual)
Area of terrestrial protected areas with high biodiversity values effectively managed increased (ha)
Area of the 13 priority inland wetlands effectively managed increased (ha)
Number of caves with high conservation id effectively managed increased
Area of residential free patents issued increased (ha)
Number of issued Certificate of Ancestral Domain Title (CADTs) increased
Number of Ancestral Domain Sustainable Development and Protection Plan (ADSDPP) formulated
Number of groundwater critical areas with management plan and monitoring wells established
Number of Major River Basins (RB) with Comprehensive Water Assessment increased
Number of biodiversity-friendly enterprises recognized increased
Number of jobs generated from reforestation and non-timber/agroforestry enterprises, i.e. NGP,CBFM, increased (M)
Number of Community Fish Landing Centers (CFLC) established (cumulative)
Percentage of new and existing CFLC operationalized (cumulative)
Environmental quality improved
Number of public utility vehicles that converted to cleaner fuels increased -Compressed natural gas -Electric/Hybrid
Solid waste diversion rate increased (%, cumulative)
Area assessed and mapped for soil fertility status and soil fertility management increased (ha)
Area of land degradation hotspots decreased (ha)
Interim rehabilitation measures monitored and implemented in 4 abandoned mines increased (%, cumulative) - Bagacay - Palawan Quicksilver - Romblon Marble - Silica Sand Mine
Percentage of the 36 surface metallic mines (operating/suspended) compliant with Annual Environmental Protection and Enhancement Program (EPEP)/Care and Maintenance Program (CMP) maintained (%)
Adaptive capacities and resilience of ecosystems increased
Number of eco-labeled products increased
Total energy savings in government offices increased (PHP million)

Number of reviewed Climate Change (CC)/Disaster Risk Reduction Management (DRRM)-enhanced plans increased - Comprehensive Land Use Plans (CLUPs) - Comprehensive Development. Plans (CDPs) - Local Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Plans (LDRRMPs)
Number of LGUs with operating early warning systems (EWS) in place increased
Number of fully-functional DRRM operations centers increased - Permanent - Temporary
GHG emissions per sector reduced (million MT CO2e) - Energy - Industrial - Agriculture - LUCF - Waste - Transport
